history.content: Have you talked to the Data Science advisors about using E7 for 61A? Just checking that this is a question about content, rather than process. I know that the EECS Vice Chairs have stressed that the content of E7 is not the same as that in 61A, though they have allowed students, for example in the EECS minor or in some of the double majors in Engineering, to use it.

Have you talked to the Data Science advisors about using E7 for 61A? Just checking that this is a question about content, rather than process. I know that the EECS Vice Chairs have stressed that the content of E7 is not the same as that in 61A, though they have allowed students, for example, in the EECS minor or in some of the double majors in Engineering to use it.

children.subject:
I should've been more clear in my original question. I'm not too concerned about content as I've taken a slew of CS courses at my community college along with the E7 equivalent. I feel confident in my foundational CS knowledge moving forward.

I'm just concerned that there will be future CS classes that I will want to take but won't be able to because they may enforce 61a and won't except E7 as an alternative. Are there any such classes? Is CS 169a one of them? Thanks.

history.content: Can E7 + 61B be used to satisfy the prereqs for CS 169a? Additionally, as a data science transfer who has taken E7 at community college instead of 61a, how screwed am I in the long run (assuming I don't take 61a)? I've already taken 61b at CC.
history.subject: 169A, Engineering 7 prereq
